verses.verse: Jesus spoke these things, then lifted his eyes to heaven and said, "Father, the hour has come; glorify your Son, so that your Son may also glorify you,
as you gave him authority over all flesh, so all whom you have given to him should have eternal life given to them.
"And this is eternal life that they may know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you sent.
"I glorified you on the earth; I finished the work that you gave me to do.
"So now, Father, glorify me alongside yourself with the glory that I had with you before the world began.
"I made your name known to the men you gave me from the world. They were yours, and you gave them to me. They have kept your word.
"They have known that everything you have given me is from you,
for the words that you have given me, I have given them. They received them and truly know that I came from you, they believed that you sent me.
"I pray for them. I do not pray for the world, but for those whom you gave me, for they are yours.
"Everything I have is yours, and yours is mine. I have been glorified in them.
"And now I am no longer in the world, but these are in the world. I am coming to you. Holy Father, through your own name, keep those whom you have given me, so they may be one as we.
"While I was with them in the world, I kept them by your name. I have kept those you gave me, and none are lost except the son of perdition, so that the Scripture might be fulfilled.
"Now I am coming to you. I speak these things in the world, so that they might have my joy fulfilled in themselves.
"I have given them your message, and the world hated them, because they are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
"I am not asking that you would take them out of the world, but that you would keep them from the evil.
"They are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.
"Sanctify them by your truth; your word is truth.
"As you sent me into the world, so I sent them into the world.
"For their sakes, I sanctify myself, so they may also be sanctified by the truth.
"I pray not just for them but also for those who will believe in me through their message,
that they may be one, just like you, Father, [are] in me and I in you; that they may be one in us; and that the world may believe that you sent me.
"I have given them the glory that you have given me, that they might be one just as we are one.
"I in them and you in me, that they may be made complete in one and that the world may know that you sent me and loved them, just as you loved me.
"Father, I want those you have given me to be with me where I am, so they may see my glory which you gave me, for you loved me before the foundation of the world.
"O righteous Father, the world didn't know you, but I knew you, and these knew that you sent me.
"I made your name known to them and will make it known, so that the love with which you loved me may be in them and I in them."
